questions.question_text: When selecting a data type for a field that will be displayed on a form, which of the following statements is NOT correct?

choices.D: Use the Date data type to enter the date and time of day
choices.B: Use the Phone Number data type to automate phone number data validation
choices.C: Use the Choice data type to limit options in a field
choices.A: Use the String data type tor a free-form text field

comments.content: There is "phone number" data type. On form go to configure->form layout->create new field-> "data type-phone number" will be there in the available data types.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
There's no "phone number" data type.

Selected Answer: D
The anwser is D only Date/Time data type allows you to choose time of day not Date.
D. to show date AND time, you need to select date / time not just date

Selected Answer: B
Exclude phone number. See the "data type" in the Application Development Fundamentals book

Selected Answer: D
D is true
D) To show Date and Time, the data type Date/Time needs to be selected

Selected Answer: D
Phone number exists and does validation

Selected Answer: B
Phone Number data type does not exist.

Selected Answer: D
D - read carefully! Date and Time, not just date.

Selected Answer: D
The data type Phone Number exists and also validates the Format so B is not the correct answer. The Date data type only is there for the date and not the time. That would be the Date/Time data type field.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/reference-pages/reference/r_FieldTypes.html

Selected Answer: D
For Date AND Time it would be "Date/Time". And "Phone Number" exists for sure.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/reference-pages/reference/r_FieldTypes.html
Option D
